CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 14, 1955, pg. 7, reads: "NAACP Play Cast - The cast and some of the color of the NAACP pageant, "Milestones of Democracy," was caught by the photographer at Wesley Center AME Zion Church Sunday afternoon, May 1. The pageant, written by Mrs. Carrie Lovett, and directed by Mrs. Helen Dandridge, was sponsored by the NAACP Women's Auxiliary to kick-off the current membership campaign.  The cast, which depicted origin and progress of the NAACP....  Group (2), seated, Roberta Ratcliffe, and Selma Gilmore.  Standing, left to right: Thelma Lovett [sic], David Haines, Martha Moore, Willa Mae Rice, Florence Washington and Carol Adams. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Cast of NAACP pageant "Milestones of Democracy," with Roberta Ratcliffe and Selma Gilmore with teapot in front; and standing: Thelma Lovette wearing Native American style costume, David Haines, Martha Moore, Willa Mae Rice holding fan, Florence Washington, and Carol Adams, at Wesley Center AME Zion Church
